title: Mini Apple Crumble
subtitle: Dessert Mission
desc: A lesson in texture. Learn to contrast soft, warm stewed fruit with a crunchy, buttery topping.

vocab.def: To cut food into small, precise cubes.
To incorporate fat into flour using fingertips.
To cook sugar until it turns brown and nutty.

steps.title: Precision Cutting
steps.desc: Wash the apple thoroughly. Slice it into 4 sections around the core. Discard the core. Place the flat side of the apple slice on the cutting board for stability. Cut into strips, then across into 1cm cubes.
steps.note: Uniform pieces cook at the same speed.

steps.title: Seasoning
steps.desc: Place apple cubes directly into an oven-safe foil cup or small baking dish. Sprinkle the Brown Sugar and Cinnamon over them. Toss until every cube looks wet and brown.

steps.title: The Sand Texture
steps.desc: In a bowl, mix Flour and Sugar. Add Cold Butter. Squash the butter into the flour using your thumbs and fingertips (Rub-in method) until it looks like crumbly, wet sand.
steps.note: Don't let the butter melt completely!

steps.title: Oats Integration
steps.desc: Stir the Rolled Oats into your sandy mixture with a spoon. Do not rub them in; we want them whole to provide the 'crunch' factor.

steps.title: Deployment
steps.desc: Pour the crumble mix loosely over the apples. Do not press it down! Bake at 180°C for 20-25 minutes until the top is golden and fruit bubbles.

title: Tropical Fizz
subtitle: Chemistry Mission
desc: A lesson in density and states of matter. Create a refreshing, gradient-colored drink.

vocab.def: Gas bubbles (CO2) dissolved in liquid.
How heavy a liquid is. Syrup sinks!
To decorate a drink to make it look pro.

steps.title: Thermal Protection
steps.desc: Fill your glass to the very brim with ice cubes. Packed ice melts slower, keeping your drink chemically stable (cold) without watering it down.

steps.title: The Heavy Layer
steps.desc: Pour the Orange Syrup directly over the ice. Watch it sink to the bottom because syrup is denser (heavier) than melted ice.

steps.title: Carbon Injection
steps.desc: Tilt the glass 45 degrees. Pour the Soda Water slowly down the inside wall of the glass. This preserves the CO2 bubbles.
steps.note: Pouring directly on ice kills the fizz.

steps.title: Activation
steps.desc: Insert a straw. Stir GENTLY only once at the bottom to create a color gradient (fade). Do not over-stir.
steps.note: We want layers, not a uniform color.

steps.title: Aromatic Garnish
steps.desc: Clap the mint leaves between your hands once (loudly) to release oils. Place on top near the straw along with the lemon slice.

title: Rainbow Logic Salad
subtitle: Knife Skills Mission
desc: Practice safe cutting techniques and color theory. No cooking required.

vocab.def: To remove the green leafy top of a strawberry.
To mix two liquids (honey & lime) together.
To mix salad gently without crushing it.

steps.title: The Claw Grip
steps.desc: Safety First! Curl your fingers like a claw when holding fruit, using knuckles to guide the blade. Cut the strawberries into quarters.

steps.title: Peel & Slice
steps.desc: Peel the Kiwi/Mango. Cut into cubes roughly the same size as the strawberry quarters. Uniform sizes make it easier to eat.

steps.title: Dressing Chemistry
steps.desc: In a small cup, mix Honey and Lime Juice. Stir very fast until the thick honey dissolves into the thin juice, creating a syrup.

steps.title: Combine
steps.desc: Place all fruit in a large bowl. Pour dressing over the top ONLY when you are ready to serve.
steps.note: Acid makes fruit mushy if left too long.

steps.title: The Toss
steps.desc: Use two spoons. Slide them down the sides and lift fruit from bottom to top. Repeat gently to coat without crushing.

title: Binary Choco-Cookies
subtitle: Baking Mission
desc: Chemistry in action. Turn dough into crispy-chewy discs of happiness.

vocab.def: To mix butter and sugar until pale and fluffy.
Gentle mixing to avoid tough cookies.
The process where cookies harden.

steps.title: Creaming Method
steps.desc: Mash soft butter and sugar against the bowl walls with a spoon/fork for 3 minutes. Stop when it turns pale yellow and fluffy.

steps.title: Bind It
steps.desc: Crack the Egg into the bowl. Mix vigorously. It may look lumpy (curdled) at first, but keep mixing until it becomes a smooth cream.

steps.title: Dry Integration
steps.desc: Add Flour and Baking Soda. Mix slowly. Stop immediately when no white powder is left (to avoid tough cookies). Fold in Choco Chips.

steps.title: Spacing Logic
steps.desc: Scoop golf-ball-sized dough onto a lined tray. Leave 5cm space between them. They will spread when hot.

steps.title: Hardening Phase
steps.desc: Bake at 180°C for 10-12 mins. Edges should be brown, center soft. Leave on hot tray for 10 mins to harden.
steps.note: They are soft when hot, hard when cold.

title: Pizza Protocol
subtitle: Assembly Mission
desc: Build a savory interface using bread as the base. Fast and reliable.

vocab.def: To make the surface hard and crunchy.
To distribute sauce evenly to the edges.
Change solid cheese to liquid deliciousness.

steps.title: Pre-Toast
steps.desc: Place plain bread in the oven at 200°C for 3 minutes. This hardens the bread so the sauce doesn't make it soggy.

steps.title: Sauce Layer
steps.desc: Remove bread carefully. Spread Pizza Sauce evenly using the back of a spoon. Leave a small border at the edges for the crust.

steps.title: Component Assembly
steps.desc: Sprinkle Mozzarella cheese to cover the red sauce. Place pepperoni or veggies on top of the cheese.

steps.title: Final Execution
steps.desc: Return to oven at 200°C. Bake for 5-8 minutes until cheese bubbles and turns slightly brown.

title: Midnight Mug Cake
subtitle: Speed Mission
desc: A single-serving cake cooked via radiation (microwaves). Instant reward.

vocab.def: To mix fast to add air and remove lumps.
The cake grows taller due to Baking Powder.
Slightly wet texture, not dry.

steps.title: Dry Compiling
steps.desc: In a microwave-safe mug, add Flour, Sugar, Cocoa, and Baking Powder. Mix with a fork until it's a uniform brown powder.

steps.title: Wet Integration
steps.desc: Add Milk and Oil. Stir vigorously. Make sure to dig the spoon into the bottom corner of the mug to get all the flour.

steps.title: The Zap
steps.desc: Microwave on High for 90 seconds. The cake will rise above the rim—this is normal! It will sink back down when it stops.

steps.title: Cool Down
steps.desc: Wait 1 minute before eating. The steam inside is extremely hot.

title: Potato Battery
subtitle: Hybrid Mission
desc: Use the microwave to cook the inside, and the oven to crisp the armor (skin).

vocab.def: To poke holes to let steam escape.
Hot gas that cooks the potato inside.
To mash the inside with a fork.

steps.title: Safety Venting
steps.desc: Wash potato. Poke it 5-6 times with a fork all over. If you don't do this, pressure builds up and it might explode.

steps.title: Core Cooking
steps.desc: Microwave on High for 5-7 minutes. It is done when a fork slides into the center easily with no resistance.

steps.title: Armor Hardening
steps.desc: Rub the skin with a little oil and salt. Place directly on oven rack at 200°C for 10 mins to make the skin crispy.
steps.note: Skip if you're in a rush.

steps.title: Loading Payload
steps.desc: Cut a cross 'X' in the top. Squeeze the sides to pop it open. Mash the inside with a fork and add butter/cheese.

title: Nacho Grid
subtitle: Sharing Mission
desc: A multi-layered defense system of crunch and cheese. Best eaten with allies.

vocab.def: Stacking ingredients (Chips -> Cheese -> Chips).
Heat from top only (if oven supports it).
Sauce served on the side.

steps.title: Foundation
steps.desc: Spread a single layer of chips on your baking tray. Do not pile them too high yet.

steps.title: Glue Application
steps.desc: Sprinkle half the cheese over the chips. Add any beans or peppers now.

steps.title: Second Story
steps.desc: Add a second layer of chips and the rest of the cheese. This creates a 3D structure.

steps.title: Meltdown
steps.desc: Bake at 180°C for 5-10 minutes. Remove immediately when cheese is melted. Serve with cold Salsa.
